data.title: Gibson Family Tree
data.text:
DESCENDANTS OF ISAAC & RITTY GIBSON

SURNAMES: ADKINS, AMY, BARKER, BOSTER, BOLING, BOWLING, BROWN, BURT, CAMPBELL, COLLINS, DODSON, GARTHEE, GIBSON, GOLDEN, GOODIN, GRIFFITH, HARNESS, HARSH, HEMBREE, HENDERSON, HICKS, JACKSON, KING, LEE, LEEK, MAIDEN, MARLEY, MASON, McCOY, MIRACLE, NARRAMORE, NICHOLS, PARTIN, PATRICK, REED, ROBBINS, RHODES, SETTLES, STOUT, TAYLOR, WICCOM, WILLOUGHBY, WORTHINGTON, ZACHARY

(Gibson Coat of Arms: Three stork's wings expanded argent CrestOut of a coronet, a lion's gamb holding an arrow gules, feathered ox. Although Gibson is believed to be of Scotish origin, the surname Gibson appears in many old English records, dating back to 1379. The moto accompanying the coat of arms well befits those who bear the name, Gibson, "Courage, Charity, and Virtue".)

The GIBSON surname ranks 116 for the most common name in the United States.

I have added a link to "Gibson Photographs" page. This is a new project of mine. It will be a collection of Gibson photographs of my family.

Thank you,

Dan Gibson, webmaster

notes: SARAH ANGELINE (BOWLING) GIBSON obituary:

"Angeline Gibson, wife of Alfred Gibson, departed this

life Sept. 11, 1913, age about 57 years. She was a devoted

member of the Bull Creek Church eleven years. Died in the

triumph of a living faith. She has gone, we believe, to her

reward in Glory. She leaves a husband and children. May they

all meet and live in Glory."

notes:

GENEVA GIBSON GRIFFITH

1922-2000

Geneva Gibson Griffith, 77, of

Fairfield, O., formerly of Scott

County, passed away on Monday,

June 19, 2000 at the Tri-County

Extended Care Facility in Fairfield,

O.

She was the daughter of the late

Thomas and Maude Ethel McCoy

Gibson and was also preceded in

death by husband, Charles

Griffith; and several brothers and

sisters.

Survivors include a son, Charles

Griffith and wife Bonnie of Cincin-

nati, O.; one sister, Edith Reed of

Ohio; one sister-in-law, Delphia

Jeffers of Knoxville; one grand-

daughter, Kelly Griffith of Cincin-

nati, O.; several nieces and neph-

ews; and other relatives and friends.

Funeral services were conducted

on Wednesday, June 21, at 1 p.m. in

the chapel of Jones and Son Funeral

Home, with Rev. John Brown offici-

ating. Burial was in Carson-Memor-

ial Park.

JONES AND SON FUNERAL HOME

of Oneida was in charge of the arrangements.

7. DONALD RAY GIBSON

birth: 08/17/1949

place: Scott County, TN

death: 03/13/2002

place: Oneida, Scott Co. TN. Donald died at his home due to heart problems.

buried: Creamated remains were buried in the Kilbeck Cemetery in the Black Creek community of Scott Co. TN. on 03/25/2002.

notes: Donald's obituary at it appeared in the Scott County News in Oneida, TN.

DONALD GIBSON

1949-2002

Donald Gibson, 52, of Oneida

passed away on Wednesday, March

13, 2002.

He was the son of the late Herstle

(Buck) Gibson and Etta Willoughby

Gibson and was also preceded in

death by an infant son.

Survivors include two daugh-

ters, Rhonda Gibson Snider and Mica

Gibson; two sisters, Faye Hileman

and Joan Key; one brother, Daniel

Gibson; four grandchildren; several

aunts, uncles, and other relatives and

friends.

A memorial services was held

on Friday, March 15, at 11 a.m. in

the chapel of West-Murley Funeral

home, with Rev. Geneva Summers

officiating.

WEST-MURLEY FUNERAL

HOME was in charge of the ar-

rangements.
